alert.note: Alert for Graham (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 3:59PM MST until August 07 at 7:30PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, Graham. * WHEN...Until 700 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 359 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms near and south of the Safford area. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Marijilda Wash, Jacobson Creek, San Simon River, Slick Rock Wash, Oak Draw and Stockton Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Safford, Roper Lake State Park and Swift Trail Junction. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
